Class Robot

  • java.lang.Object
    • Robot

  • public class Robot
extends java.lang.Object
    Object that carries out primary tasks for robot including navigation Calls on Locator, Communicator and Navigator to complete tasks
    Author:
    Allen Gurdus, Victor Sacristan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Robot(Navigator theNavigator, Communicator theCommunicator, Locator theLocator, Detector theDetector)
      Constructor

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addToInBox(Message message)
      Adds message containing command that was sent by communicator
      void avoider()
      Detector calls on it when an obstacle is detected stop the robot asap and backup report to PC side, so obstacle can be drawn and position can be updated
      boolean checkBomb()
      check if we still have the Bomb if yes set data[0]=1, if no data[0]=0 report this information to PC side it compares two getDistances instead of comparing a getDistance with the distance from the scanner to the back of the robot just in case the bomb is there but is not stock in our robot
      void execute(Message message)
      Executes commands held in messages by using enum to deCode header
      void fixPosition()
      Utilizes Locator to fix robot position to proper pose
      void go()
      Carries out commands in inbox checks constantly if the inbox is empty, if not executes commands
      void map(float mapDirection)
      MAP if obstacle is found calls reportObstacleDistance() to report to PC side calls on myLocator to get distance to obstacles
      void navigate(float[] destination, boolean map, float mapDirection)
      Carries out goTo command based on destination coordinates Use a boolean, true in case map is needed.
      void pickBomb()
      pick the bomb calls on myScanner.bomb() to find the bomb location calls on checkBomb(), to see if we have the bomb, if not restart everything Scans always forward to avoid the possibility of picking our own robot by scanning backwards
      void ping(int angle)
      get the distance of obstacle in the angle direction if obstacle is found set data[0]=1, if not data[0]=0 report this information to PC side
      void reportObstacleDistance(float distance, float angle)
      Reports distance of objects at certain angle to Mission Control to build map
      void reportPose()
      Sends current pose to communicator so it can be sent to Mission Control
      void rotateTo(int angle)
      Robot rotates to a given heading
      void setMessage(int header, float[] data)
      Method that convert data from the communicator into a message that can be read by the robot After that is added into the inBox
      void setPose(float[] pose)
      Sets pose for robot
      void stop()
      Stops robot ASAP Don't need pilot.stop cause pilot is always access from myNavigator.moveController and myNavigator.stop() stops his move controller
      void travel(int distance)
      Robot travels a given distance in direction of current heading

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • navigate

        public void navigate(float[] destination,
            boolean map,
            float mapDirection)
        Carries out goTo command based on destination coordinates Use a boolean, true in case map is needed. For mapping left mapDirection = 1, -1 for right
        Parameters:
        destination, - map, mapDirection

      • map

        public void map(float mapDirection)
        MAP if obstacle is found calls reportObstacleDistance() to report to PC side calls on myLocator to get distance to obstacles
        Parameters:
        maping - direction

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops robot ASAP Don't need pilot.stop cause pilot is always access from myNavigator.moveController and myNavigator.stop() stops his move controller

        Parameters:

      • pickBomb

        public void pickBomb()
        pick the bomb calls on myScanner.bomb() to find the bomb location calls on checkBomb(), to see if we have the bomb, if not restart everything Scans always forward to avoid the possibility of picking our own robot by scanning backwards

      • checkBomb

        public boolean checkBomb()
        check if we still have the Bomb if yes set data[0]=1, if no data[0]=0 report this information to PC side it compares two getDistances instead of comparing a getDistance with the distance from the scanner to the back of the robot just in case the bomb is there but is not stock in our robot

      • avoider

        public void avoider()
        Detector calls on it when an obstacle is detected stop the robot asap and backup report to PC side, so obstacle can be drawn and position can be updated
